title: How to Treat Vachetta Leather

parts.name: Preventing and Treating Stains on Vachetta

steps.headline: Allow the leather to darken in the sun.
steps.description: Vachetta leather is very light to start, but as it’s exposed to wear and tear, it typically darkens, developing a darker tan color known as a patina. The leather stains more easily when it’s light, so you may want to help the patina along by placing the leather in the sun for an hour or so each day to develop a tan color that won't show stains as easily. It can take two to three weeks of regular sunning for the vachetta leather to develop an even patina.

steps.headline: Choose a water and stain repellent spray to protect the leather.
steps.description: If you like the light color of new vachetta and don’t want to encourage it to develop a patina, you can treat it with a water and stain repellant spray for leather products that will prevent stains from setting in. Avoid repellent products that must be painted or brushed on, though, because they may darken the vachetta. You can purchase water and stain repellent spray for leather at most stores that sell leather products, such as department stores and mass merchandise stores. It's also available from online retailers.

steps.headline: Mist the water and stain repellent spray over the item and allow it to dry.
steps.description: To avoid darkening the leather, follow the instructions on the repellent spray packaging carefully. Be careful not to saturate the vachetta with the spray. Hold the bottle the recommended distance from leather and mist it lightly and evenly. Let the leather dry for a day before using the item. Always do a spot test before using the spray on leather. Mist a small amount of the repellent on an inconspicuous area of the vachetta and wait a day to see how it reacts. If the leather doesn’t darken, you can apply it all over.

steps.headline: Rub a clean eraser over dark marks.
steps.description: If you notice a black mark, streak, or stain on your vachetta, a simple white eraser can help to remove it. Make sure that the eraser is clean and lightly rub it over the mark to remove it. Use the eraser on the mark as soon as you spot it. That will give you the best chance of removing it. Be sure to use a white eraser. Colored erasers may stain the leather.

steps.headline: Apply a wax-free leather conditioner to a cloth.
steps.description: Set out a clean towel on your table or work surface and place your vachetta leather item on it. Next, take a soft, clean cloth and dampen it with a generous amount of wax-free leather conditioner. Make sure the space that you’re working in is well-ventilated. Work outdoors if possible, or open a window and turn on a fan indoors. You can purchase wax-free leather conditioner from most stores that sell leather goods, such as department stores, mass merchandise stores, and leather goods boutiques. Online retailers also sell it.

steps.headline: Do a spot test with the conditioner on the vachetta.
steps.description: Find a hidden area of the leather and apply the conditioner to it. Wait a day or so to see if the conditioner discolors the leather. If it doesn’t, you can apply it all over.

steps.headline: Rub the conditioner over the vachetta.
steps.description: When your cloth is damp with the conditioner, gently apply it all over the vachetta. Make sure to wipe it over the vachetta lightly and evenly to ensure that the leather isn’t damaged.

steps.headline: Let the leather dry for about an hour.
steps.description: Leave the vachetta item on the clean towel to dry for at least an hour after it's treated with the conditioner. Don’t use a blow dryer or other heat tool to try to speed the drying time or you may damage the leather.

steps.headline: Buff the leather with a clean cloth.
steps.description: When the conditioner has dried completely, use a soft, clean cloth that’s dry to gently buff the vachetta leather. This restores a nice luster to the leather and remove any surface scratches.

steps.headline: Keep vachetta leather off the floor.
steps.description: Because it’s untreated, vachetta can stain very easily. If you place a bag or other item with vachetta accents on the floor, it can easily pick up dirt and develop stains. Place vachetta items on clean surfaces or in your lap to ensure they stay clean.

steps.headline: Avoid placing vachetta leather on dirty or greasy surfaces.
steps.description: Floors aren't the only surfaces that may potentially stain vachetta. Because it stains so easily, try not to set it down on dirty or greasy surfaces, such as kitchen counter tops. If you have to set a vachetta item on that type of surface, set a clean towel down first to protect the leather.

steps.headline: Store vachetta leather in a box or dust bag.
steps.description: When you’re not using your bag, jacket, or other item, it’s important to store it safely. Place it in a box or cotton dust bag to protect the vachetta leather from dirt and dust that may damage it. Don’t use a plastic bag to store a vachetta item. The leather won’t be able to breathe in the bag, which can dry and damage it.

steps.headline: Tuck vachetta straps inside a bag when not in use.
steps.description: If you have a bag with vachetta straps, it’s a good idea to tuck them inside when you’re not carrying the bag. That will keep the bag’s hardware from scratching the leather and doing damage.

tyn: Leather water and stain repellent spray
Dust bag or other storage container
text: Preventing and Treating Stains on Vachetta Allow the leather to darken in the sun. Vachetta leather is very light to start, but as it’s exposed to wear and tear, it typically darkens, developing a darker tan color known as a patina. The leather stains more easily when it’s light, so you may want to help the patina along by placing the leather in the sun for an hour or so each day to develop a tan color that won't show stains as easily. It can take two to three weeks of regular sunning for the vachetta leather to develop an even patina. Choose a water and stain repellent spray to protect the leather. If you like the light color of new vachetta and don’t want to encourage it to develop a patina, you can treat it with a water and stain repellant spray for leather products that will prevent stains from setting in. Avoid repellent products that must be painted or brushed on, though, because they may darken the vachetta. You can purchase water and stain repellent spray for leather at most stores that sell leather products, such as department stores and mass merchandise stores. It's also available from online retailers. Mist the water and stain repellent spray over the item and allow it to dry. To avoid darkening the leather, follow the instructions on the repellent spray packaging carefully. Be careful not to saturate the vachetta with the spray. Hold the bottle the recommended distance from leather and mist it lightly and evenly. Let the leather dry for a day before using the item. Always do a spot test before using the spray on leather. Mist a small amount of the repellent on an inconspicuous area of the vachetta and wait a day to see how it reacts. If the leather doesn’t darken, you can apply it all over. Rub a clean eraser over dark marks. If you notice a black mark, streak, or stain on your vachetta, a simple white eraser can help to remove it. Make sure that the eraser is clean and lightly rub it over the mark to remove it. Use the eraser on the mark as soon as you spot it. That will give you the best chance of removing it. Be sure to use a white eraser. Colored erasers may stain the leather. Conditioning Vachetta Leather Apply a wax-free leather conditioner to a cloth. Set out a clean towel on your table or work surface and place your vachetta leather item on it. Next, take a soft, clean cloth and dampen it with a generous amount of wax-free leather conditioner. Make sure the space that you’re working in is well-ventilated. Work outdoors if possible, or open a window and turn on a fan indoors. You can purchase wax-free leather conditioner from most stores that sell leather goods, such as department stores, mass merchandise stores, and leather goods boutiques. Online retailers also sell it. Do a spot test with the conditioner on the vachetta. Find a hidden area of the leather and apply the conditioner to it. Wait a day or so to see if the conditioner discolors the leather. If it doesn’t, you can apply it all over. Rub the conditioner over the vachetta. When your cloth is damp with the conditioner, gently apply it all over the vachetta. Make sure to wipe it over the vachetta lightly and evenly to ensure that the leather isn’t damaged. Let the leather dry for about an hour. Leave the vachetta item on the clean towel to dry for at least an hour after it's treated with the conditioner. Don’t use a blow dryer or other heat tool to try to speed the drying time or you may damage the leather. Buff the leather with a clean cloth. When the conditioner has dried completely, use a soft, clean cloth that’s dry to gently buff the vachetta leather. This restores a nice luster to the leather and remove any surface scratches. Maintaining Vachetta Leather Keep vachetta leather off the floor. Because it’s untreated, vachetta can stain very easily. If you place a bag or other item with vachetta accents on the floor, it can easily pick up dirt and develop stains. Place vachetta items on clean surfaces or in your lap to ensure they stay clean. Avoid placing vachetta leather on dirty or greasy surfaces. Floors aren't the only surfaces that may potentially stain vachetta. Because it stains so easily, try not to set it down on dirty or greasy surfaces, such as kitchen counter tops. If you have to set a vachetta item on that type of surface, set a clean towel down first to protect the leather. Store vachetta leather in a box or dust bag. When you’re not using your bag, jacket, or other item, it’s important to store it safely. Place it in a box or cotton dust bag to protect the vachetta leather from dirt and dust that may damage it. Don’t use a plastic bag to store a vachetta item. The leather won’t be able to breathe in the bag, which can dry and damage it. Tuck vachetta straps inside a bag when not in use. If you have a bag with vachetta straps, it’s a good idea to tuck them inside when you’re not carrying the bag. That will keep the bag’s hardware from scratching the leather and doing damage.
sentences: Preventing and Treating Stains on Vachetta Allow the leather to darken in the sun.
Vachetta leather is very light to start, but as it’s exposed to wear and tear, it typically darkens, developing a darker tan color known as a patina.

The leather stains more easily when it’s light, so you may want to help the patina along by placing the leather in the sun for an hour or so each day to develop a tan color that won't show stains as easily.
It can take two to three weeks of regular sunning for the vachetta leather to develop an even patina.
Choose a water and stain repellent spray to protect the leather.

If you like the light color of new vachetta and don’t want to encourage it to develop a patina, you can treat it with a water and stain repellant spray for leather products that will prevent stains from setting in.
Avoid repellent products that must be painted or brushed on, though, because they may darken the vachetta.
You can purchase water and stain repellent spray for leather at most stores that sell leather products, such as department stores and mass merchandise stores.
It's also available from online retailers.
Mist the water and stain repellent spray over the item and allow it to dry.
To avoid darkening the leather, follow the instructions on the repellent spray packaging carefully.
Be careful not to saturate the vachetta with the spray.
Hold the bottle the recommended distance from leather and mist it lightly and evenly.
Let the leather dry for a day before using the item.
Always do a spot test before using the spray on leather.
Mist a small amount of the repellent on an inconspicuous area of the vachetta and wait a day to see how it reacts.
If the leather doesn’t darken, you can apply it all over.
Rub a clean eraser over dark marks.
If you notice a black mark, streak, or stain on your vachetta, a simple white eraser can help to remove it.
Make sure that the eraser is clean and lightly rub it over the mark to remove it.
Use the eraser on the mark as soon as you spot it.
That will give you the best chance of removing it.
Be sure to use a white eraser.
Colored erasers may stain the leather.
Conditioning Vachetta Leather Apply a wax-free leather conditioner to a cloth.
Set out a clean towel on your table or work surface and place your vachetta leather item on it.
Next, take a soft, clean cloth and dampen it with a generous amount of wax-free leather conditioner.
Make sure the space that you’re working in is well-ventilated.
Work outdoors if possible, or open a window and turn on a fan indoors.
You can purchase wax-free leather conditioner from most stores that sell leather goods, such as department stores, mass merchandise stores, and leather goods boutiques.
Online retailers also sell it.
Do a spot test with the conditioner on the vachetta.
Find a hidden area of the leather and apply the conditioner to it.
Wait a day or so to see if the conditioner discolors the leather.
If it doesn’t, you can apply it all over.
Rub the conditioner over the vachetta.
When your cloth is damp with the conditioner, gently apply it all over the vachetta.
Make sure to wipe it over the vachetta lightly and evenly to ensure that the leather isn’t damaged.
Let the leather dry for about an hour.
Leave the vachetta item on the clean towel to dry for at least an hour after it's treated with the conditioner.
Don’t use a blow dryer or other heat tool to try to speed the drying time or you may damage the leather.
Buff the leather with a clean cloth.
When the conditioner has dried completely, use a soft, clean cloth that’s dry to gently buff the vachetta leather.
This restores a nice luster to the leather and remove any surface scratches.
Maintaining Vachetta Leather Keep vachetta leather off the floor.
Because it’s untreated, vachetta can stain very easily.
If you place a bag or other item with vachetta accents on the floor, it can easily pick up dirt and develop stains.
Place vachetta items on clean surfaces or in your lap to ensure they stay clean.
Avoid placing vachetta leather on dirty or greasy surfaces.
Floors aren't the only surfaces that may potentially stain vachetta.
Because it stains so easily, try not to set it down on dirty or greasy surfaces, such as kitchen counter tops.
If you have to set a vachetta item on that type of surface, set a clean towel down first to protect the leather.
Store vachetta leather in a box or dust bag.
When you’re not using your bag, jacket, or other item, it’s important to store it safely.
Place it in a box or cotton dust bag to protect the vachetta leather from dirt and dust that may damage it.
Don’t use a plastic bag to store a vachetta item.
The leather won’t be able to breathe in the bag, which can dry and damage it.
Tuck vachetta straps inside a bag when not in use.
If you have a bag with vachetta straps, it’s a good idea to tuck them inside when you’re not carrying the bag.
That will keep the bag’s hardware from scratching the leather and doing damage.
